text: and that has to affect you if you are human, you know.

speaker: A
text: So they had to work all that, that anger out, and the, and the nightmares that come along with it.

speaker: A
text: I do not, I do not really think that anybody can ever forget that,

speaker: A
text: but they can, they can reason and, and try to adjust to, to why they were there.

speaker: B
text: Well, you see that is what the veterans are so angry about now.

speaker: B
text: They say, "Well, we're, going to listen to this and we are going to look at this, find out what our mistakes were, and we are not going to make them again."

speaker: B
text: But that does not undo the ones that were done.

speaker: B
text: And that is what makes the veterans angry.

speaker: B
text: I do not know a solution.

speaker: B
text: But I sure cannot blame them for being angry.

speaker: B
text: On the other hand, you know, you can be angry about something for a very long time,

speaker: B

speaker: A

speaker: A

speaker: A
text: And then it just blew up into the war.

text: Well, it has been that way for a very, very long time, though.

text: So, and, and, and the Asians historically have always had these kinds of wars going on.

speaker: B
text: we should not have maybe gotten involved.
